Posts.Content: Aug 30, 2012 09:22AM kittykoma05 wrote: Justegan - You have been so brave through your BC journey!  Don't feel bad if you are feeling sad for all the things that are being taken away from you.  Let all your feelings out, you will feel better afterwards.  I'm sorry that you have to go through more treatments on top of the BC treatment.  I am sending you a big hugh!  Being brave is great, but you have every right to be upset and show it.
Posts.Title: Any August 2012 girls? shabby6485 Beckers

Posts.Content: Aug 24, 2012 08:10AM kittykoma05 wrote: I have decided to go with Dr. Mry Brian.  She is with Texas Oncology.  Her office just called to inform me that my surgery is scheduled for Sep. 14.  I am sooo scared.  I am freaking out because I have so many questions and I have so much to do before the surgery.  Has anyone here used Dr. Brian before?  I will be using Dr. Rumalla as my PS. Thanks, Laura

Posts.Content: Aug 25, 2012 10:37PM kittykoma05 wrote: Ladies, Thank you so much for sending me the names of your doctors! grt - I will be having a bilateral mastectomy with immediate reconstruction (TE) and sentinel node biopsy. Does anybody know if I'll need a bra after the surgery? Thanks!

Posts.Content: Sep 6, 2012 08:39AM kittykoma05 wrote: Thanks Miren!  I have big breasts now, so I'm not used to going anywhere without a bra.  I guess I'll have to get used to my new body once those puppies come off.  Not having to wear an underwire bra will be one of the very few good things about my surgery.  Sorry to hear about the infection, it sounds like it lasted along time.  I will be having surgery in the hospital in Southlake.  I am soo ready to get it over with! Laura

Posts.Content: kittykoma05 wrote: Hello, My name is Laura.  I was just diagnosed with breast cancer.  I recently moved to the DFW area from Houston, so I don't know a lot of people here.  I am looking for some recommendations for doctors who can help me beat this cancer.  Please let me know if you are in my area and if you recommend your doctors.  Also, I'm looking for support groupd in my area.  I must not be thinking clearly beause I haven't found any local support groups yet.
